summary:
Malawi, a landlocked country in Southeast Africa, has a rich history. Once known as Nyasaland, it gained independence from British rule in 1964. The country faced a repressive dictatorship under Hastings Banda but transitioned to a democratic republic in the 1990s.

With a growing population, Malawi's economy relies on agriculture. It is considered one of the least-developed nations, relying on aid, but has shown progress in recent years. Challenges include high infant mortality, HIV/AIDS, and building infrastructure. Malawi has a diverse culture with various ethnic groups and languages, and it actively participates in international organizations.
title: Malawi
